v.v: Come near, you nations, and listen; pay attention, you people!
For Yahweh is angry with all the nations, and furious against all their armies;
The bodies of their dead will be thrown out. The stench of the dead bodies will be everywhere;
All the stars of the sky will fade away,
For when my sword will have drunk its fill in heaven;
The sword of Yahweh is dripping with blood and covered with fat,
Wild oxen will fall with them, and young bulls with the older ones.
For it will be a day of vengeance for Yahweh and a year when he will pay them back for the cause of Zion.
The streams of Edom will be turned into pitch, her dust into sulfur,
It will burn night and day; its smoke will rise forever;
But wild birds and animals will live there; the owl and the raven will make their nest in it.
Thorns will overgrow her palaces, nettles and thistles her fortresses.
The wild animals and the hyenas will meet there, and the wild goats will cry to one another.
Owls will make nests, lay and hatch their eggs, hatch and protect their young.
Search through the scroll of Yahweh; not one of these will be missing.
He has cast lots for their places, and his hand has measured it out for them by a cord.

v: The earth and all that fills it must listen, the world, and all things that come from it.
he has completely destroyed them, he has handed them over to the slaughter.
and the mountains will soak up their blood.
and the sky will be rolled up like a scroll; and all their stars will fade away,
as the leaf fades from off the vine, and as the overripe figs from the fig tree.
look, it will now come down on Edom, on the people I am setting apart for destruction.
dripping with the blood of lambs and goats, covered with the fat of the kidneys of rams.
For Yahweh has a sacrifice in Bozrah and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
Their land will be drunk with blood, and their dust made fat with fatness.
and her land will become burning pitch.
from generation to generation it will be a wasteland; no one will pass through it forever and ever.
He will stretch over it the measuring line of ruin and the plumbline of destruction.
will have nothing left to call a kingdom, and all her princes will be nothing.
It will be a habitation of jackals, a place for ostriches.
Nocturnal animals will settle there and find for themselves a place of rest.
Yes, there hawks will gather, each one with its mate.
None will lack for a mate; for his mouth has commanded it, and his spirit has gathered them.
They will possess it forever; from generation to generation they will live there.
